Column Comment.0: BATCH IDENTIFIER: Unique identifer for the batch or collection of samples that arerun through an analysis at the same time for comparitive purposes.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: BATCH DESCRIPTION: Narrative comments about the batch that was created.
Column Comment.3: BATCH NAME: Common name given to the batch.
Column Comment.4: BATCH REFERENCE NUMBER: A reference number assigned to a batch orcollection of samples that are run through an analysis at the same time forcomparative pruposes. If equipment has been tampered with, or something bad hashappened (e.g. powerorwateroutage), you would be able to find everything in thesame batch.
Column Comment.5: BATCH CREATE DATE: The date on which this batch was created for inclusion in ananalysis run.
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.8: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.9: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.10: SAMPLE COUNT: The number of samples that are included in this batch. Can becalculated by adding the number of rows in SAMPLE ANALYSIS SAMPLE, if thisinformation is available. This number should include any standard samples that areincludedin the batch.
Column Comment.11: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.12: STANDARD SAMPLE COUNT: The number of standard samples that are included inthe batch. Descriptions of standard samples are contained in the SAMPLE family oftables. Standard samples are used to help identify or quantify certain components ofsamples.
Column Comment.13: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.15: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.17: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
